<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q12')" data-correct-answer="B">
  <strong style="display: block;">How does diversification affect the risk of an investment portfolio?</strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q12" value="A"> A. Diversification increases both risk and expected return.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q12" value="B"> B. Diversification reduces unsystematic (firm-specific) risk but cannot eliminate systematic (market) risk.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q12" value="C"> C. Diversification guarantees higher returns regardless of market conditions.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q12" value="D"> D. Diversification eliminates all forms of investment risk.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q12" value="E"> E. Diversification has no impact on portfolio volatility.</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q12" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: B. Diversification spreads investments across assets, reducing unsystematic (idiosyncratic) risk tied to individual securities. However, systematic risk — stemming from economy-wide factors — remains even in well-diversified portfolios.
</div>
